result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle L. McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle L. McGeshick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle L. McGeshick was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Kyle L. McGeshick was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Prison term currently serving.
Concurrent with: Count 1 but consecutive to prison term now serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle L. McGeshick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court/custody with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:29 am. Resolution - Count 4 amended to mis BJ - count 1 plead - count 2 & 3 dismissed - joint recommendation 9 months jail  on each count to run concurrent to each other and consecutive to sentence now serving, costs on each count. State has complied with VN. Court reads amended charge/penalties. Pleads guility to count 1 and amends count 4 to mis BJ and pleads G - court dismisses count 2&3. Court goes thru plea questionnarie and finds that defendant entering plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering plea and waiving right to JT, factual basis and adjudges guility of count 1 and count 4 as amended. Final statements by State/Scholke. McGeshick makes statement. Court sentences to following:

Count 1 - 9 months jail (huber &) - costs - consecutive to prison sentence now serving. 

Count 4 - 9 months jail (huber & )  concurrent with count 1 and consecutive to prison sentence now serving - costs. Taken from prison wages - 60 DTP/CO once released. DNA sample - any credit will be granted if paperwork stipulation too. 

Appeal rights.

Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:42 PM. Scholke - not resolved - has gone over the ramification of rejecting to plea offer and he understands those, did file a request for substitution knowing that it is past the PH stage. Court has denied the request for substitution as it is not timely. State - offer - plead G to counts #1 and #4, DRI #2 and ##  - 6 months in FC jail and 1 year in jail on count #4 - to run concurrent to each other. McGeshick originally thought the time was consecutive to each other but still wants time to think about it, not prepared to make that decision at this time. State - believes the defendant likes to play the system. Court goes thru rejection of offer collaquey, continues bond, set for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:32 PM. Scholke indicates he was recently assigned this matter and had asked previous counsel for discovery, has not received anything and asks for adjournment, also states defendant had requested previous counsel file a substitution of judge. Defendant indicates he is not aware of offer. State hands offer to Scholke in court, Scholke informs State offer is from a previous case. Court suggests State send new discovery to Scholke. State will get discovery out to Scholke. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Judicial notice of certified bail bond from FC Case #13CF67

Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:16 PM. Rielly - proceed with PH. State calls Office Donald Belland. Belland sworn in at 3:18 PM. Direct exam by State at 3:18 PM. StateCourt receives copy of authenticated bond, parties stipulate to probable cause on the felony bond count and Court receives the certified bond in case #13CF67. Court sequestors witnesses. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Rielly at 3:26 PM. State objects - sustained (3:28 PM). Belland excused at 3:29 PM. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Rielly has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney Mary Burns who appears specially for Attorney Michael Hughes today. Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:16 AM. Burns has complaint but has not reviewed it with the defendant. Defendant does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands charges and penalties except for bail jumping charges. Burns waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, sets for PH. Hughes should contact JA if that day is not available to him.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
REFUSED TO SIGN. No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim.
